de.unihannover.se.iviewxjava.core.reactive

Class ETStreamService<E extends ChronologicComparable<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unihannover.se.iviewxjava.core.reactive.ETStreamService<E>

  • public class ETStreamService<E extends ChronologicComparable<E>>
extends Object
    Asynchronously running service that publishes data in a reactive stream.

    This service provides a powerful tool to work with data from a ETReceiver by leveraging the RxJava 2 library.

    To use this service, simply start it and subscribe to the reactive stream returned by getStream.

    If you want to stop the service, call stop.

    The service runs asynchronously, so by default, subscriptions will subscribe on the service thread. It is advised to use observeOn in combination with a computational scheduler to make sure you don't block the service with your computations. Also you will have to keep backpressure in mind, since data might be produced at a very rapid rate. RxJava provides backpressure mechanisms (onBackpressureLatest is a great way to handle eyetracking data streams) to handle these kinds of situations.

    See Also:
    RxJava

    • Constructor Detail

      • ETStreamService

        public ETStreamService(ETReceiver<E> receiver)
        Constructs a new ETStreamService with the given receiver.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the stream service.

        The service will stream data as fast as possible. Beware that this will use a lot of processing power.

      • start

        public void start(long pollrate)
        Starts the stream service with the given pollrate.

        The service will pause for the specified time between each request to the receiver. This will reduce the stress on your CPU for sources, that often respond with ETResponseType.NO_NEW_DATA_AVAILABLE when requesting new data without a time delay.

        Parameters:
        pollrate - Time delay between each request to the receiver

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the service.
        Throws:
        ETStreamException - if a timeout occurs when stopping the service

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Stops the service and publishes onComplete to the stream.
        Throws:
        ETStreamException - if a timeout occurs when stopping the service

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns if the service is currently running.
        Returns:
        true, if the service is running, else false

      • getStream

        public io.reactivex.Flowable<E> getStream()
        Returns the data stream.

        The returned Flowable is part of the RxJava 2 library and provides the entry point for the whole functionality of the reactive framework.

        Returns:
        Data stream
